question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Take care to ensure the code you produce is executable and demonstrable. Program a complete software solution for a supermarket WeChat mini-program, featuring online display, product categorization, shopping cart functionality, barcode scanner support, date management, inventory management, and image support. Priced at 10 yuan for 3 items, with supermarket checkout capability.

checklist.title: Is the WeChat mini-program structure properly implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code follows WeChat mini-program framework requirements, including correct use of app.js, app.json, app.wxss for global configurations, and proper page structure. Check that page lifecycle methods (onLoad, onShow, etc.) are correctly implemented. Score 0 if mini-program structure is missing, 5 if basic structure exists but with incorrect implementation, and 10 if fully compliant with WeChat development standards.

checklist.title: Is the product catalog and categorization system fully functional?
checklist.description: Evaluate the implementation of product categorization, including data structure design, category navigation, and filtering capabilities. Check if products can be properly sorted and filtered by category, price, popularity, etc. Score 0 if categorization is missing, 5 if basic categorization exists but lacks sorting/filtering, and 10 if the system includes hierarchical categories with multiple sorting and filtering options.

checklist.title: Are the shopping cart and checkout functions complete?
checklist.description: Assess whether the shopping cart implementation handles adding/removing items, quantity adjustments, price calculations (including the 10 yuan for 3 items pricing rule), and checkout process. Check for order submission, payment integration with WeChat Pay, and order confirmation. Deduct 5 points if pricing rules are incorrectly applied, 3 points if quantity management has bugs, and 2 points if the checkout flow is incomplete. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the barcode scanner functionality properly integrated?
checklist.description: Check whether the barcode scanning feature uses WeChat's native camera API, processes scan results correctly, and links scanned products to the inventory system. Verify that both item lookup and checkout can be performed via barcode scanning. Deduct 5 points if the scanner doesn't properly integrate with product database, 3 points if error handling for invalid barcodes is missing, and 2 points if performance is poor. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as network interruption, invalid user input, product not found, payment failures, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. AR product preview 2. Voice search for products 3. Personalized recommendations based on purchase history). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple shopping cart algorithms) 2. Function modules unrelated to supermarket shopping (e.g., social media sharing unrelated to purchases) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations that slow down the interface). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating business logic/UI/data services), component reusability, and build process optimization for WeChat mini-program. Deduct 5 points if global state management is chaotic; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if no automated testing exists for critical flows like checkout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows WeChat mini-program design principles: 1) Consistent with WeChat's visual language 2) Proper component spacing and alignment 3) Professional typography system (suitable font sizes for different content hierarchy). Deduct 3 points for each UI inconsistency with WeChat guidelines, 5 points for cluttered product listings, and 5 points for poor information hierarchy. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to WeChat mini-program performance standards: 1) Page transitions under 300ms 2) Shopping cart updates reflect immediately 3) Clear loading states for network operations. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for laggy scrolling in product lists, and 5 points for unreliable product search functionality. The full score is 10 points.
